meanings.definition: To hang or suspend something from above.
meanings.sent1: She decided to uphang the painting on the wall.
meanings.sent2: The light fixture uphangs from the ceiling in the living room.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to uphang its toy mouse from the doorknob.
meanings.sent4: His dreams uphang like stars in the night sky, just out of reach.
meanings.sent5: The chandelier uphangs elegantly in the grand ballroom.

meanings.sent1: The bird feeder uphangs from the tree branch.
meanings.sent2: The swing uphangs from the sturdy beam on the playground.
meanings.sent3: The piñata uphangs, waiting to be broken open at the party.
meanings.sent4: The clouds uphang in the sky, casting shadows on the ground below.
meanings.sent5: The banner uphangs proudly outside the school, displaying the team's victory.

meanings.sent1: The uphang of the chandelier added elegance to the room.
meanings.sent2: The uphang of the hammock provided a relaxing spot in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The uphang of the bat in the cave startled the explorers.
meanings.sent4: The uphang of the mist in the valley created a mystical atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The uphang of the painting on the gallery wall caught everyone's attention.
